data.title: many deprecation replacements not in docs
data.body:
I've run into several cases where the deprecation notice says to use xyz instead of abc but the api docs still say to use abc.  And zyz will often not be in the docs at all.  Also there are a lot of deprecated things like TextEditorView referenced.

I don't think it's fair to give a deadline for packages to be upgraded to 1.0 when the docs aren't.

data.title: Bootstrap upgrade renders Command Palette keybindings white on light UI themes
data.body:
Since the Bootstrap update with Atom Version 0.201.0 the keybindings displayed in the Command Palette are not readable anymore when using a light UI theme like One Light or Atom Light.

![onelightkeybindings](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/176818/7784782/33eb840c-0172-11e5-90c9-43073e3c26a7.png)
The new bootstrap now sets a white color for the `kbd` tag.

data.title: The update squirrel should not be colored for release notes
data.body:
The little squirrel icon that appears when there is an update it's perfect.

But it's coloured even when there is no update but just to point you to the release notes. I find this behaviour confusing.

I think it should act as follows:
- Coloured when there is an update to install
- Gray when it's there to point you to the release notes

data.title: Atom rendering/cursor position completely broken with ligatures
data.body:
Lately I have been playing with fonts with ligatures like PragmataPro, Fira Code, Hasklig, etc...

The only way I have found to make Atom to actually render any ligature is by adding `text-rendering: optimizeLegibility` to my style config. Anyways, this completely breaks pretty much the entire editor. Cursor position stops working correctly (a single ligature requires 2 or 3 left/right arrow clicks for the cursor to move back/forwards), the delete key acts really funny, etc...

Even more, after commenting `text-rendering: optimizeLegibility`, Atom keeps doing funny stuff until I restart it.

Those type of fonts are getting more and more common; it would be really nice if Atom could handle them correctly.

Btw, PragmataPro works just fine in Chrome, test it here: http://typecast.com/preview/myfonts/113975  (be sure to add `text-rendering: optimizeLegibility` to the textbox you'll be testing.

data.title: SoftWrap requires a small explanation sentence
data.body:
Hello,

I wanted to remove softwrap at preferred line length, but I did not know about the term, I just knew what I wanted to do. It took me long time to figure out the correct setting. Some settings have a small explanatory sentence. Would you consider including one for softWrap?

Many thanks

data.title: Fix application:open-license command
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6918

The issue here was that `atom.getLoadSettings().resourcePath` was returning the path to `app.asar`, but the LICENSE.md currently doesn't get placed inside `app.asar` â€“ it lives directly inside the resources directory. This gets around that by using `process.resourcesPath` like https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/browser/atom-application.coffee#L210, but this probably isn't the best approach since `process.resourcePath` won't change if you launched Atom normally but have a dev mode window active.
- Should we generate LICENSE.md inside `app.asar`?

/cc @atom/feedback @kevinsawicki

data.title: Atom does not remember session
data.body:
I have a root project folder, but when I remove it (or add other project folders), it forgets the changes and always goes back to the previous project folder.

This is version 0.201.0 (and previous versions), Windows 8.1, and happens in Safe Mode as well.

data.title: Position of cursor after undo+redo is incorrect
data.body:
In most text editors after:
- typing some text (the text cursor ending at position A),
- moving the text cursor somewhere else (the text cursor ending at position B),
- undo,
- redo,

the cursor ends up at position A, but in Atom it end at position B.

data.title: Critical: Opening a file with command line arguments ends up in wrong encodings
data.body:
Calling `atom.cmd filename` on windows, or opening with `node atom.js filename` , always ends up with UTF-8 encoding, even if its not. Auto-detect doesn't seem to be triggered when opened from arguments.

However, manually triggering auto-detect seems to do the trick.

But this is serious, as there is no warning of any kind, and the file will end up being filled up with garbage due to wrong encoding, with no way to reverse it.

data.title: Opening projects via Atom command
data.body:
Opening a project under the working directory, the following would suffice.

``` bash
cd ~/project100
atom
```

When I run `atom` on a second project under the working directory

``` bash
cd ~/project101
atom
```

the editor does not open that project (no tree view of project101 folder), but a clean atom instance. 
I noticed this change since 0.199 release.

data.title: Startup window size saved incorrectly when maximzed
data.body:
When maximized and then exited, it saves the sizes and not the maximization. And it ends up opening un-maximized, but with the maximized sizes. 

**Correct behaviour should be:** If maximized, use the value of last resize before maximization, but also flag the maximization. 

On Windows, resizing due to Aero-Snap behaviors should be not be saved, and ignored. Similar behavior to maximization has to be used for correctness.

data.title: UI (status bar and tab bar) becomes too large when maximizing the Atom window
data.body: I noticed that in the 0.201 release Atom now scales the size of its status bar and tab bar according to the size of the Atom window. This makes the status bar and tab bar too big when you maximize Atom. Could it be related to the Bootstrap 3.3.4 addition in 0.201? The scaling behaviour matches what you would get from a Bootstrap enabled responsive web site.

data.title: :memo: Document command name standard
data.body:
Not entirely sure about the wording, and location of the paragraph, but perhaps not too bad?

/cc @atom/feedback 

---

Resolves #6893

data.title: Remove cursor when there are multiple cursors if Cmd-Clicking on it
data.body: From a discussion in Slack â€“ it would be really nice if <kbd>Cmd / Ctrl-Click</kbd>ing on a cursor when you have multiple cursors removed that cursor. This would make it a lot easier to fine tune your set of multiple cursors after the fact.

data.title: Menu bar cannot be activated by keyboard
data.body:
For example, pressing `Alt+F` should open `File` menu, then press `->` to move to `Edit` menu.
On Windows 7/8, this does not work after the main editor is focused, except for the welcome page.
On Ubuntu Linux (Unity), the menu bar can be activated normally by keyboard.

Atom version: 0.201

data.title: Skip linting fixtures
data.body:
Refs #6898, https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5982, and https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/6230#discussion_r27896062

This adds a `.coffeelintignore` file to ensure that no one accidentally lints the `spec/fixtures` directory, lest we break the universe.

data.title: Command `atom -a` equivalent to `Add project Folder`
data.body:
Hi,
It could be great to have a additional option in command line for add the path to open to the current treeview. Why not `-a` ?
It is currently only possible with the menu `Add project Folder`

data.title: Fail to syntax highlight sometimes.
data.body:
Atom fail to syntax highlight ramdomly at : https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/0b34de005cfbff82c972830aa3bbe3938c7bec4f

Tested with javascript and python. 

Had to switch other language highlight and back to fix that.

data.title: Grammar Pattern Not Applying Name Class When There is a Nested Pattern
data.body:
I apologize if this is a duplicate. I'm not quite sure what else to search for to find any possible related issues.

**Summary:** Capture name not applied when there are nested patterns.

**Atom Version:** 0.201.0
**Platform:** OS X Yosemite 10.10.3

If we take the following line in the Java Properties format:

```
dotted.property=true
```

It renders as follows:

![screenshot 2015-05-22 08 03 37](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2270905/7770160/413f387a-0059-11e5-97cc-e269d687f05b.png)

Notice that there is no span for the key (dotted.property). It appears loose inside the meta span for the key-pair.

Now if we look at the pattern in question:

```
  {
    'begin': '^\\s*(([\\S&&[^:=\\\\]]|\\\\.)+)\\s*([:=])?'
    'beginCaptures':
      '1':
        'name': 'support.constant.java-properties'
        'patterns': [
          {
            'match': '\\\\([tnfr"\'\\\\ ]|u\\h{4})'
            'name': 'constant.character.escape.java-properties'
          }
        ]
      '3':
        'name': 'punctuation.separator.key-value.java-properties'
    'end': '\\n'
    'name': 'meta.key-pair.java-properties'
    'patterns': [
      {
        'begin': '(?=\\S)'
        'end': '(?<!\\\\)(?=\\n)'
        'name': 'string.unquoted.java-properties'
        'patterns': [
          {
            'match': '\\\\([tnfr"\'\\\\]|u\\h{4}|)'
            'name': 'constant.character.escape.java-properties'
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
```

From my understanding, this pattern should be applying class _support.constant.java-properties_ to the property key.

Now, if I remove the nested patterns, it renders how I would expect:

![screenshot 2015-05-22 08 02 21](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2270905/7770210/e3f09a64-0059-11e5-830f-91cb7ed2652d.png)

The key now has its own span with the appropriate class applied.

data.title: Font selector instead of input field
data.body:
It would be so much easier to choose fonts if Atom's Setting had an ctual dropdown instead of an input field for the font. Please add it.

Also, can you make each line in the dropdown to be rendered with the font that it represents?

data.title: Changing tabs using mouse steals focus from text editor
data.body:
Platform: OS X 10.10
Atom Version: 0.201.0

Description:
Changing tabs using the mouse button (clicking on them) steals the focus from the editor window and requires another click into the text to continue writing. 

Expected behavior:
Text editor regains focus after tabs are switched.

Note:
Changing tabs using keyboard shortcuts works and won't steal the focus

data.title: Atom asks twice for deletion of file
data.body: When I click with right button on some file or folder in treeview, Atom ask if I want to delete file which is currently open and then it asks once more correctly for file of folder which was clicked. It's really confusing and I've already deleted some files by mistake.

data.title: Lint for even more style errors
data.body:
The sequel to https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/6230

I'm sure making the package linting job harder for myself :stuck_out_tongue_closed_eyes:, but I figured I should do this now before I add linting support to any more packages â€“ this updates coffeelint.json to lint for more code style errors.

Let me know if these changes seem reasonable!

/cc @atom/feedback

data.title: Add an option to auto-update certain packages
data.body: Sick of every time I open Atom having to update stuff...

data.title: Buffer changed event doesn't handle line endings correctly
data.body:
Tested on windows. 
# Test

Open the console when a text file is active and run the following: 

```
ed = atom.workspace.getActiveEditor()
ed.setText("





























");
ed.buffer.onDidChange(function(diff){ console.log(JSON.stringify({ oldText: diff.oldText, newText: diff.newText })) });
```

Now make the text file active and `press enter`. 
# Errors

What is actually inserted : `
`
What is reported by the buffer : `
`. 
# Refs

Refs : https://github.com/TypeStrong/atom-typescript/issues/354
